content: hi @WG-prioritization, react with :wave: to show you're around
the idea was to discuss how to improve our process
how well we think the async things we are doing work
how well or bad our sync weekly meeting works
what kind of ideas do we have to improve our process
that's the idea, so, I guess we can start by commeting briefly on what is it working, maybe?
I think overall it's going well!
I think it's having a positive effect on the compiler triage meeting as well.
:+1:
maybe let me rephrase things better
I'd change well or bad with things that are helping us or working well and things that could be improved
any other thought about what's helping the team and in general the weekly main meeting?
I think async prioritization goes really well too
one thing I'd add is that I think the ... what @LeSeulArtichaut has said :)
maybe it needs a bit of structure, but otherwise it is fine
It doesn't take a lot of time for the members here

DPC said:

maybe it needs a bit of structure, but otherwise it is fine

say more?
And still gets the job done IMO
currently for some issues, someone proposes one of the labels, it doesn't get marked for a long time
while for some issues, someone proposes and it is marked instantly and removed for prioritisation so some uniformity would makes things better :slight_smile:
right, I'd say that once we have 2 people saying this is P-whatever someone can just go an apply the label
in any case we can keep discussion and re-label
that's one idea but I general at some point I go over all the zulip discussions I didn't participate and check what happened
if people are saying P-medium and I agree I just add the label :)
maybe in future it would be nice if we could label it from the zulip conversation
I agree and I think there were plans for this in triagebot?
but in general feel free to take ownership, things will be reviewed anyway at some point, at least I can promise that I'm going to review all the I-prioritize, whatever me reviewing means :P
Shouldn't be too hard I think
24 hours seems a good time to get consensus on ? if something is unlabelled 24h after opening i'll add it accordingly

DPC said:

maybe in future it would be nice if we could label it from the zulip conversation

I agree with this, mainly because it's nice to add also a brief text and link to the discussion
I think we can add a todo somewhere
unsure what do you guys prefer but I guess for now I can use this doc
Another small improvement may be to rename topics once prioritization is removed
I can open an issue on triagebot, maybe?

LeSeulArtichaut said:

I can open an issue on triagebot, maybe?

this is great and agree, let's open an issue, although a problem this doesn't solve is where do we look at all the pending things we have?
what was more or less the intention I have with the doc but a document for this is far from ideal :)
We could maybe have a "meta-topic" somewhere? I don't really know how practical that would be

lcnr said:

Another small improvement may be to rename topics once prioritization is removed

this is also a good idea, maybe we can replace I-prioritize with P-high, P-medium, etc
well I guess we are more or less done with what's working nice?
let's jump into what could be improved?
I can for now add some things into that document until we define something better to use
let's jump into the improving things part :)
I have a bunch but want to hear from others first :)
not really the process we do, but what happens to an issue if a PR to fix it is already opened? During triaging there seems to be some confusion regarding this

I’m sometimes confused by what we’re supposed to do, I mean I d really like to help, but I feel like I don’t always understand if something / what is expected.
It’s the main reason why I wanted to focus on something specific like for example draining an unprioritized issue queue
Not sure if my comment is actually something we can act on though ^^’
well don't be afraid to be wrong :P

DPC said:

not really the process we do, but what happens to an issue if a PR to fix it is already opened? During triaging there seems to be some confusion regarding this

I'd assign a priority anyway, unsure if I got the question right though :)
Well I tend to lower the priority if there’s already an open pr like “let’s not focus on that “

o0Ignition0o - Jeremy Lempereur said:

I’m sometimes confused by what we’re supposed to do, I mean I d really like to help, but I feel like I don’t always understand if something / what is expected.
It’s the main reason why I wanted to focus on something specific like for example draining an unprioritized issue queue

I'd say feel free to ask questions and if you want we can talk in private and I can try helping you

o0Ignition0o - Jeremy Lempereur said:

Well I tend to lower the priority if there’s already an open pr like “let’s not focus on that “

this is an interesting discussion and mainly if there's confusion, my take is ... let's ignore the PR existance
mainly because a PR may take time to land
conflicts
reviews
etc

the question is: what do we do if a pr is already open to fix the issue?
A] label as usual,
B] lower it
C} don't nominate it

just want to ensure we all are on the same page
if it is really P-critical and we miss the release it will be bad

DPC said:

the question is: what do we do if a pr is already open to fix the issue?
A] label as usual,
B] lower it
C} don't nominate it

just want to ensure we all are on the same page

I'd go with just A
I think we should do A, as sometimes PRs don't pan out and we may end up forgetting important issues
it may be nominated if the PR needs to be discussed or may affect something
ok seems like we are on the same page :)
what else do we feel can be improved?
in my opinion the main meeting per se
I think it's right now sub-optimal
I have to admit
it feels a lot "robotic" and one-person show at the moment rather than a group effort :slight_smile:
Well we’re basically all watching you move stuff around :D
I have wondered if we need a label for "has-pr"
github already puts a little note next to the link to the pr, saying "this PR will close this issue when it is merged"
but that isn't reflected in the metadata for the issues themselves (i.e. the labels)
it also lists the PRs linked to that issue
but there's no way to filter by it
so its just hard to track these details down quickly
I guess these are separate but related problems: what to do with an issue when a PR to fix it gets opened (but not merged), and how to quickly determine if an issue is in that state
I’m afraid it might get out of sync if a pr gets closed or something :/
that's also a fair problem.

DPC said:

it feels a lot "robotic" and one-person show at the moment rather than a group effort :)

yes this is not what we want and I know we are suffering this problem
correct me if I'm wrong, but currently, wg-prioritization does not do a weekly review of all the P-high issues, correct?
we don't review all P-high rn
(back in the day, such a review was part of the weekly pre-triage. but then I become overwhelmed as the pile of P-high issues grew too large to review in a short sitting)
yeah we don't do a group review
I check them to see if there's something we need to nominate
in my ideal world, wg-prioritization (or some team/wg) would be able to do such a review
but that's not a group effort

pnkfelix said:

in my ideal world, wg-prioritization (or some team/wg) would be able to do such a review

yes
of course having a lead do it would suffice
I wonder if it is possible that if a PR is closed and the issue is marked P-* then the issue is automatically re-requested for prioritisation (a bit of work getting this implemented though)
as long as such a review is happening, then presumably the issue of a has-pr label going out of sync would not be a problem for P-high and P-critical isues
just P-medium or below ones

pnkfelix said:

of course having a lead do it would suffice

yeah but I guess we want to do a group effort in general
so that's something to improve
/me is once again distracted by a child and must go afk again
RE: the meeting. I think @DPC mentioned that would it would nice if we could divide up some of the work and potentially do it concurrently
so about things to do in general I'd say that we need to change all the individual procedures for team efforts
That would give us meeting time to do other things
and I think we want to get rid of the meeting

Wesley Wiser said:

That would give us meeting time to do other things

yes
my idea is to move most of the efforts async
and maybe have bi-weekly meetings like this one :)
more oriented to strategy, planning, etc
do we agree on a strategy like that?
I meant, move most stuff async, automate most stuff and have periodic planning/steering meetings
FYI, opened triagebot#591
by seeing the :+1:s I guess we do agree
so, I think we can talk about how to make that happen
i have cc'd the wg on the pr
we have this up https://github.com/rust-lang/triagebot/pull/579
which helps a bit in automation of what is currently happening in the meeting
but that needs to be run by someone
and does everything at one run
which is not what we want
but I guess we can keep improving by taking small steps :)
maybe it's worth discussing a bit what we are doing right now
most of the stuff can be seen starting here https://hackmd.io/pHb6eTZ2Sjy6XZmwXZHIBA#Pre-triage
prioritizing Unprioritized I-prioritize is already done async
Regressions part is also async, we are getting closer with stable to stable ones
I think anyway most of the things needs to be done close to the meeting date, so we could do something async but it needs to happen on tuesday
maybe instead of having a sync meeting what we could do is start one zulip topic per section of the document and do what's needed but taking the whole day in an async way to do that
does something like that sounds reasonable?
Absolutely
ok, that's one part
the other two parts are ... 1. what do we do with nominations?
maybe we can automate also nominations, we could also create a topic for nominations
and our missing there is to check if we should add the nomination to the agenda and we need to bring a small summary about each nominated item
Having a standardized set of questions might help to structure things?
what needs to be done when something is nominated?
For what we should write in that summary
it will be checking if the nomination if for T-compiler
Mhh, nevermind, I don't think that would help, in the end
sometimes we have a nomination and labels for t-compiler and t-lang
it may be nominated for t-lang and not t-compiler
then yeah we can have a separate zulip thread for each
so first we need to check that
and then come up with a little summary on why is it nominated and some key info
the idea is to make @pnkfelix life easier during the meeting
if we do not provide a summary he needs to figure out a lot of things live
basically he would need to completely read the issue
the idea would be that with the summary compiler members may want to read the issue anyway but they will have a clear overview about what's going on
for instance ...

• "Incorrect non-exhaustive pattern error" #72476
    • It is also a regression.
      - supposedly injected by PR #71930
      - (assign to Nadrieril?)
      - Has an open PR that likely will fix the issue.
    • Rejects valid code.
    • Really quickly detected (2 days).
    • Seems to be a problem when pattern matching on structs/enums which contain a projection.

Santiago Pastorino said:

the other two parts are ... 1. what do we do with nominations?

back to this, I'd say we should create a zulip topic and try to come up with all this information and conclusions
same happens with P-critical issues
we need to add a summary
i think that's a good start because it gives a clear picture of what happens when something is nominated or not and how can we improve on it later
we seem to clearly need to document all this too :)
in part that's what the procedure is about
(same thing with priotisation - once we split it into threads it made things really clear for me)
the procedure is a document
well it s a bit related to the prio document i started working on, i d love to push it through and land it somewhere
but now that we have the script, the procedure could be just a document that helps understanding what we need to do and looks less like pasteable info

o0Ignition0o - Jeremy Lempereur said:

well it s a bit related to the prio document i started working on, i d love to push it through and land it somewhere

yeah, please open a PR in forge and cc this group

Santiago Pastorino said:

the other two parts are ... 1. what do we do with nominations?

I've said this was two parts, part 2 is reviewing P-high as @pnkfelix has mentioned
anyway, we may want to quickly come up with some actionable things
there are some zulip ideas
is someone willing to work on some of those?
I would like to continue pushing the meeting automation forward
the main script
time is up, maybe what we should do is reserve some time from tomorrow's meeting to make a plan out of this discussion?
how do we create threads for each section? manually? :P
AUTOMATION!
I'd love if we can say ... @triagebot prioritization start
isn't the meetings on wednesdays? :P
and have that opening 7 zulip topics, creating the blank agenda and all that :)
cc @simulacrum :innocent:

DPC said:

isn't the meetings on wednesdays? :P

yes, I was talking about our meeting which is tomorrow, just in case

Santiago Pastorino said:

and have that opening 7 zulip topics, creating the blank agenda and all that :)

we could slowly turn my "script" into this

Santiago Pastorino said:

time is up, maybe what we should do is reserve some time from tomorrow's meeting to make a plan out of this discussion?

does this sound good or something?
I guess with 20 minutes we could get this sorted
I think we should do so
I'm going to add some of the ideas from this topic into the master document and I guess we could see if there's a way to assign some of this work tomorrow maybe?
sure
but I also believed the wg-prioritization meeting to be in 2 days :sweat_smile:
oh sorry you're both right :)
it's on wednesday, sorry sorry and @DPC was right too
:slight_smile:
so yeah, on wednesday during that meeting :)
I was about to say "timezones" x)
hehe
i'm okay with that
anything else we need to discuss or we are calling this meeting closed? :D
@WG-prioritization as a follow up of this meeting, I've created some tasks that I think we should accomplish
added all that here https://hackmd.io/P3yvagSSS7yAI2QxhLfPtQ?both#Tasks
the new ones are ...

• [Santiago] Make a proposal of an async process and have bi-weekly planning/steering meetings to think about things to improve.
    • start one zulip topic per section of our procedure document and we can work on each section async during the whole day maybe.
  • [Santiago] Document our process, make our existing procedure more like our documentation.
    • We can turn it into something that explains a bit more what we need to do now that the script is more about the procedure.
  • Create a topic per nominations and PRs waiting on team
    • create a topic once an issue is nominated/PR waiting on team.
    • send a text with directives on what to do on every nomination or PR waiting on team that is like ...
      • Sanity check if the nomination/pr waiting is really for T-compiler/libs-impl
      • We want to add them to the agenda with some basic information about why the issue was nominated/waiting, what's the status, etc
  • Create a topic per P-critical and P-high regressions
    • create a topic once an issue is tagged with P-critical/P-high regression.
    • send a text with directives on what to do on every one of them like ...
      • Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
      • Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
      • Check if there are relevant issues that are worth raising awareness.
  • [Santiago] Move Prioritization meeting automation #579 forward.
  • Propose a strategy to review all P-high issues
  • Add command for relabeling issues from Zulip #591.
  • Add I-prioritize to I-unsound issues that are not requires-nightly
    • More info https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/should.20we.20consider.20I-unsound.20issues
  • [pnkfelix] Define if we want to create a has-pr label
I've assigned some of that stuff to myself but there are some with no one assigned, if somebody wants to tackle something from that work it would be great :)
